{"step_by_step_thinking": "Arthroscopic acetabular labral repair is a minimally invasive surgical procedure performed on the hip joint. The acetabular labrum is a ring of cartilage that surrounds the hip socket and helps to provide stability to the joint. During the procedure, the surgeon uses small instruments and a camera to repair or remove damaged parts of the labrum. While the procedure is generally safe, there is always a risk of injury to nearby structures during any surgical procedure. In the case of arthroscopic acetabular labral repair, the pelvic anatomical structures could potentially be at risk.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
